Can we make this a little simpler?
If I understand correctly,

We pass dispatch of the store to other child components
On change in any component the component dispatches a status change
and here we an observable and have a useRef on it for any changes
and useEffect on the status
and on each status change we use the observable to refetch the list of secure keys.

Instead of all these can we pass in a callback to all the components (SecureKeysEdit, SecureKeysDelete and SecureKeysCreate), say onClose which will be called on unmounting  and here on the function we simply refetch all the keys?

This way we don't have to pass in the dispatch function. This will be problematic to track since in the future if we want to see where a change is happening. Events can be dispatched by any of the child components for a state maintained in the parent.
Resolved! Now dispatch only resides in the main component SecureKeys/index.tsx

I think you don't need to use observable to watch for changes. The events are deterministic in this case, so you should be able to fetch the the list of secureKeys in a deterministic way on a callback. On update (add, edit, and delete), the modal will call handleClose. You can fetch the list of secure keys on the callback being passed to handleClose
